title: Direct x error again
body: Every time I try to play a game, after  champ select my game crashes and i get the direct x error, my drivers are up to date. I've tried deleting my config, restarting my computer, doing a full repair, none of it has worked.

replies.body:
I don't know if it's a guaranteed fix, but I was (and could possibly be still having) the same problem. Yesterday, my game did that DirectX issue when playing in a group of 5 friends....fortunately a normal that time. I restarted my computer several times, and then turned of all program starts...and it worked. So I played some League and figured it was a Discord problem. Then today, hop on to play some games, start up a ranked game...but instead of loading into the game get that same DirectX problem. Tried a similar fix, to no avail. Plus, my league kept saying I was on an old version and it wanted to restart to update (and then do nothing), and still the game wouldn't load. So I went to look at the drivers...my card said I was up to date so I didn't know what was up.

As a last ditch effort I went to the driver download area on AMD's website. I find a download for a thing that automatically detects and installs the updates, and figured why not try it. I did and it said I was missing an update. Updated it (not the optional just the recommended) and restarted. Gave League a shot and it worked (in a custom game). Can't guarantee it will work (since I got it to work last time, and then it stopped the next day), but seems good so far. I'll update as I learn more.

Got the AMD check thing here: http://support.amd.com/en-us/download

Sorry I can't guarantee it, but I hope it helps.

Edit: I feel I should add, the site says it only works on Windows Computers.
Was able to play a game today with no problems.
Today I got the DirectX error again, guess it didn't work.

Are you running on AMD and recently had it updated?  If so, can you roll it back then try again through a custom game?  A resolution mis-match between your screen and the came could cause this as well.  A config reset might help, just make sure to test it out in a custom game.

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings. 

Should that fail, run through the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide to help rule out some possibilities, and let me know the results.

Yes i  am running on amd but i updated it around when 7.9 came out because i was having the same problems. It fixed it self at some point, though i dont know how. Maybe it was due to the rollback to 7.8. I tried to delete those config files while the game was open, then when I tried to do a practice battle it had the same error. I tried running dxdiag and it said there were no problems found.

We've been seeing a few reports on this, and believe there may be an issue with AMD's driver causing the DirectX error.  To help troubelshoot, would you be down to download a [previous AMD driver](http://support.amd.com/en-us/download/desktop/previous?os=Windows%2010%20-%2064)?  Let me know if it works.
i just downloaded an old driver installed it then restarted my computer and it still crashes :(

Weird!  In this case, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can see if something else might be causing this.  Download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well for some logs and attach it to your ticket for context.   We'll see you there!
Not sure how, but again it seemed to fix itself. after downloading the old version and restarting and still not having it work, I reinstalled the updated drivers and restarted my pc and it worked.
